The State of Maryland will commit an additional $6 million to help facilities cover the cost of nursing home staff testing. To date, the state has dedicated nearly $102 million to testing and PPE for nursing homes.

Effective immediately, nursing homes and assisted living facilities can begin allowing limited indoor visitation, as well as compassionate care visits. To qualify, facilities must have no active cases in the last 14 days and no outbreak testing in progress.

Today I announced the safe resumption of indoor visitation at Maryland nursing home facilities. @MdPublicSchools Superintendent Dr. Karen Salmon also announced that child care providers in Maryland may return to full teacher to child ratios.

This morning, I will be meeting virtually with the @ProbSolveCaucus to discuss their bipartisan “March to Common Ground” proposal and to provide an update on our bipartisan interstate rapid testing compact.

The fight against this virus is far from over, and we must all continue to remain vigilant. Our health and economic recovery depend on all of us continuing to exercise personal responsibility in order to keep ourselves, our family members, our neighbors, and our coworkers safe.

Beginning next Friday, June 19 at 5:00, indoor gyms and other studio fitness activities may begin to safely reopen at 50% capacity with strict health, distancing, and sanitization measures. Casinos, arcades, and malls will also be able to begin safely resuming operations.

Also effective this Friday at 5:00, outdoor amusements and rides, miniature golf, and go-kart tracks may resume with appropriate health and safety protocols. Capacity restrictions at outdoor pools will increase to 50%.
Effective this Friday, June 12 at 5:00 p.m., indoor dining will be able to resume at restaurants across the state at 50% capacity with distancing and strict public health requirements.

Because of the early and aggressive actions taken, we have not only flattened the curve—we have actually crushed the curve in Maryland. After continued improvement in key metrics, we are in position to continue with additional Stage Two reopenings: https://t.co/LyRRzePhk8 https://t.co/xl5EoVUqIo

In the absence of this federal support, states will have to confront the prospect of significant reductions to critically important services all across this country, hampering public health, the economic recovery, and—in turn—our collective effort to get people back to work.

Congress must appropriate an additional $500B specifically for all states and territories to meet the states’ budgetary shortfalls that have resulted from this unprecedented public health crisis, separate from much needed fiscal stabilization for local governments.

To stabilize state budgets and to make sure states have the resources to battle the virus and provide the services the American people rely on, Congress must provide immediate fiscal assistance directly to all states.
Despite this grave challenge, the recently passed federal CARES Act contained zero funding to offset these drastic state revenue shortfalls.

Governors across the country are implementing a variety of stay at home orders and other aggressive measures that are successfully flattening the curve. While these public health strategies are working, they result in catastrophic damage to state economies.

One thing I’ve learned is that life is much too short, and that is why I will keep giving this job everything I've got every single day that I am given.

The outpouring of support after I announced the diagnosis to the people of Maryland was incredible, and today I am feeling especially blessed and thankful for that and to remain cancer-free and in complete remission.

Fighting through the challenge of non-Hodgkins lymphoma taught me invaluable lessons: to make the most of every day, to take every opportunity to do something great, and to focus on the truly important things in life.

Laura and Reid’s Law is named in honor of Howard County educator Laura Wallen and her unborn son. It increases sentences for those who commit crimes of violence against women they know or believe to be pregnant.

Stacey’s Law clarifies that a person who solicits or conspires with another to commit murder is guilty of 1st degree murder if the crime occurs. Stacey Lynn Seaton was only 17 when she was killed by a hired gunman.

A new law will close loopholes in order to expand workers’ compensation coverage for firefighters. It is named for PG County firefighter Jesse McCullough, who passed away last year after a battle with cancer.

I also signed a measure that includes our legislation to classify felony human trafficking as a violent crime. Our administration is committed to securing justice for victims of this heinous crime—learn more: https://t.co/urfVZMiQcj.

Grace’s Law 2.0 is a precedent-setting measure to increase penalties for cyberbullying with the intent to induce a minor to commit suicide. It is named in honor of 15-year-old Grace McComas, who died tragically as a result of vicious cyberbullying.

We introduced the Repeat Drunk Driving Offenders Act 3 years in a row. The legislature finally agreed to increase penalties for impaired driving, particularly for those convicted more than once and those who cause death or serious injury.
I was proud to sign a number of bills that will go into effect tomorrow, many of which are essential to the safety and security of Marylanders. https://t.co/YqOZWWiqyh

I will continue standing up and fighting for the Jewish community in Maryland and across America, and that I will continue to stand proudly with the state of Israel.

We have seen far too many acts of anti-Semitism and hatred in our nation. In response, we enacted legislation to help protect schools & childcare centers and directed state law enforcement agencies to increase their vigilance in protecting our synagogues and places of worship.

Maryland’s collaboration with Israel has produced notable achievements in medicine, healthcare, and biotechnology; important advancements to defense, the cyber industry and our homeland and national security; and new partnerships with great Israeli companies.

Every day that I have been Maryland's governor, I have been a strong supporter and advocate, not just for Maryland’s Jewish community, but also for the state of Israel, which is one of America’s best and most important allies.
I’m honored to deliver the opening address for the 2019 National Conference of the @JNFUSA, an incredible organization dedicated to serving the people and land of Israel.
